instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00291: What is 820-00291? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00291</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no life
threads.message:
No LEDs. I injected to the 12v line and checked with the thermal imager. 
<TRANSISTOR>Q8450</TRANSISTOR> gets warm. <CHIP>U6920</CHIP> get hot though. No shorts to ground though. 

I'm realizing I don't have any parts for this board though as it's 12v. Can anything from macbook be substituted for these? 
If not, any way to confirm <CHIP>U6920</CHIP> is the issue before ordering?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00291</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no life
threads.message:
Injected into 12V why???
Did you detect short there?

<SIGNAL>12V_S0</SIGNAL>, or <SIGNAL>12V_S5</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00291</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no life
threads.message:
I didn't inject 12v, but I slowly injected to <SIGNAL>PP12V_ACDC</SIGNAL> as I do not have any power supply for this. Never made it over 2v. Received the board only. 

Board had no first LED.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00291</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no life
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00291</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no life
threads.message: Can these be substituted from any macbook boards?
